pageContext.claim: “So the so-called HHS Whistleblower [Richard Bright] was against HYDROXYCHLOROQUINE. Then why did he make, and sign, an emergency use authorization? @NorahODonnell said, 'He shared his concerns with a reporter.' In other words, he LEAKED. A dumb @60Minutes hit job on a grandstanding Never Trumper!”
pageContext.analysis: The president left out the crux of Bright’s allegation. In a detailed whistleblower complaint, Bright says that he was sounding the alarm about hydroxychloroquine early, that he was “directed” to sign an emergency application for the drug’s use in hospitals despite his reservations, and that he did it as a compromise with Trump appointees who were pushing to release the drug even more widely.
